original: @326b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @326b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: b'a da n+ya ya n'a ma pra ka ra na /
analyzed: b'a da n+ya ya n'a ma pra ka ra na /
translated: VƒÅdanyƒÅyanama-prakara·πáa

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rtsod pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rigs pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa /
translated: The treatise entitled ‚ÄúThe Logic of Debate‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i rdo rje la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed Ma√±juvajra.

original: rtsod pa dag la rigs pa smra ba rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar dgod pa'i sgo nas g-yo sgyu can tshar gcod par byed pa'i phyir de sun dbyung ba'i don du 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: rtsod pa dag la rigs pa smra ba rnams kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa nye bar dgod pa'i sgo nas g-yo sgyu can tshar gcod par byed pa'i phyir de sun dbyung ba'i don du 'di brtsams so //
translated: Since those who speak logically in debates refute the deceitful by means of presenting what is not correct, this is composed for the purpose of refuting that.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag mi brjod cing //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag mi brjod cing //
translated: Not stating the branches of proof

original: skyon mi brjod pa gnyis po dag / tshar gcad pa yi gnas yin gyi //
analyzed: skyon mi brjod pa gnyis po dag / tshar gcad pa yi gnas yin gyi //
translated: and not stating faults are both grounds for defeat,

original: gzhan ni mi rigs phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi rigs phyir mi 'dod //
translated: but others are not accepted because they are illogical.

original: sgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub pa'o //
translated: Proof is the establishment of the intended meaning.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa ni yan lag go //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa ni yan lag go //
translated: Its means of establishment are the branches.

original: de brjod pa ni sgrub pa'i yan lag brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni sgrub pa'i yan lag brjod pa'o //
translated: Stating those is stating the branches of proof.

original: de mi brjod pa'i rgol ba ni tshar bcad pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de mi brjod pa'i rgol ba ni tshar bcad pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: A debater who does not state those is a ground for defeat.

original: de khas blangs nas rgol ba ni spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de khas blangs nas rgol ba ni spobs pa med pas mi smra bar 'dug pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The opponent, having accepted that, remains silent, having no confidence to dispute further.

original: sgrub pa'i yan lag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i yan lag la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, the reason is not stated because the part of the proof is not capable.

original: rtags rnam pa gsum nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa sgrub pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: rtags rnam pa gsum nyid ni mngon sum ma yin pa sgrub pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: The three types of reason are the part of the proof of what is not directly perceived.

original: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩde la nus pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa'o // de la nus pa ni /
translated: They are nature, effect, and non-apprehension.

original: bsgrub @327a * //üîΩpar bya bas khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: bsgrub @327a * // par bya bas khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Regarding that, capability isüîΩthe proof of the existence

original: chos can la yod pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos can la yod pa sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: of the subject, having established the pervasion by the probandum.

original: 'di ltar gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang yod pa'am byas pa de thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
translated: It is like this: Whatever exists or is produced is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa la stsogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la stsogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: sgra yang yod pa'am byas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra yang yod pa'am byas pa'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Sound also exists or is produced.

original: 'di la yang go rims kyi nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yang go rims kyi nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, there is no fixed order at all,

original: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par gnyi ga bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don sgrub par gnyi ga bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are indistinguishable in establishing the intended meaning.

original: chos can la dang por yod pa nyid rab tu bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: chos can la dang por yod pa nyid rab tu bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having first established existence in the subject,

original: phyis kyang khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs pa nyid ni /
analyzed: phyis kyang khyab pa rab tu bsgrubs pa nyid ni /
translated: Later, the pervasion is well established.

original: dper na sgra ni yod pa'am byas pa yin la de lta bu gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgra ni yod pa'am byas pa yin la de lta bu gang yin pa de thams cad ni mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: For example, sound is existent or produced, and whatever is like that is impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like a pot and so on.

original: 'dir khyab ba sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir khyab ba sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub par bya ba la bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar bstan pa ste /
translated: Here, the proof of the pervasion is the presentation of a valid cognition that contradicts the opposite of the probandum.

original: gal te dngos po yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te dngos po yod pa'am /
translated: If all existent things

original: byas pa thams cad skad cig ma re re la 'jig par ma gyur na /
analyzed: byas pa thams cad skad cig ma re re la 'jig par ma gyur na /
translated: or produced things did not disintegrate in every moment,

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa mi rigs pa'i phyir /
translated: then it would not be logical for non-momentary things to perform functions either gradually or instantaneously.

original: yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni don byed nus pa yin la /
translated: The definition of existence is the ability to perform a function.

original: de las ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would be the opposite of that,

original: med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: it would only be non-existent.

original: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: nus pa nye bar brjod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of being devoid of all expressions of ability

original: nye bar brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar brjod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the absence of expression.

original: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan na /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub par byed pa'i bsgrub par bya ba las bzlog pa la gnod pa can gyi tshad ma nye bar ma bstan na /
translated: Thus, if a valid cognition that contradicts the probandum is not presented in regard to the proof of that,

original: 'di bzlog pa la yod pa ma mthong du zin kyang yod pa'am /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa la yod pa ma mthong du zin kyang yod pa'am /
translated: then even though one does not see the existence of the reversal of that,

original: byas pa rtag ces bya ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir /üîΩldog pa med pa nyid du the tshom za la ;
analyzed: byas pa rtag ces bya ba la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir / ldog pa med pa nyid du the tshom za la ;
translated: there is no contradiction in saying that it exists or that the produced is permanent.üîΩTherefore, one doubts that it is not reversed.

original: de las ldog ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las ldog ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: And because one doubts the reversal of that, it becomes uncertain.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'o //
translated: It is a fallacious reason.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not reverse it merely by not seeing it,

original: bskal pa dag la thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i ma mthong ba ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bskal pa dag la thams cad gzigs pa ma yin pa'i ma mthong ba ni med pa sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the non-seeing of one who is not omniscient in the course of eons does not prove non-existence,

original: tshu rol mthong bas ni yod pa yin du zin kyang don 'ga' zhig ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong bas ni yod pa yin du zin kyang don 'ga' zhig ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who sees only what is near does not see some object even though it exists.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang gang la rim dang cig car 'brel ba med pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu yang nus pa med de /üîΩde ni skad cig ma ma yin pa la yod pa'i phyir 'di ltar rab tu 'jug pas nus pa med pa yod pa @327b ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang gang la rim dang cig car 'brel ba med pa de ni 'ga' zhig tu yang nus pa med de / de ni skad cig ma ma yin pa la yod pa'i phyir 'di ltar rab tu 'jug pas nus pa med pa yod pa @327b ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'dren par byed do //
translated: It is not a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation, but it is not a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to other objects of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir gang yod pa'am byas pa de ni mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes grub bo //üîΩde tsam gyis kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yod pa'am byas pa de ni mi rtag pa kho na yin no zhes grub bo // de tsam gyis kyang sgrub par byed pa'i chos tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid 'grub par 'gyur ro//
translated: The definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.

original: gal te 'dir yang ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na gang gi phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa nyid la nus pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'dir yang ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin na gang gi phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa nyid la nus pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.

original: sngar gyi gtan tshigs la yang khyab pa med do //
analyzed: sngar gyi gtan tshigs la yang khyab pa med do //
translated: The definition of a valid cognition that is an affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is an affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.üîΩThe definition of a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation is: a valid cognition that is a non-affirming negation in relation to the object of negation.

original: 'di la yang gzhan sgrub par byed pa nye bar sbyor na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la yang gzhan sgrub par byed pa nye bar sbyor na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you prove the other, then there is the fault of infinite regress.

original: ma yin te /üîΩmed pa sgrub par byed pa la ma mthong ba ni bkag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te / med pa sgrub par byed pa la ma mthong ba ni bkag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: No, it is not so.üîΩFor, in proving a non-existent, non-perception is not a negation.

original: ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: ma mthong bas ni bsgrub par bya ba bzlog pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: For, by non-perception, one proves the reversal of the reason in the reversal of the probandum.

original: 'dir 'gal ba nye bar 'god pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir 'gal ba nye bar 'god pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, it is because of the establishment of the contradiction.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called a valid cognition that contradicts.

original: de ltar na ni gtan tshigs de bsgrub bya med pa la gang gi tshe tshad ma dang ldan pa rang 'gal bas gnod pa'i phyir med pa bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ni gtan tshigs de bsgrub bya med pa la gang gi tshe tshad ma dang ldan pa rang 'gal bas gnod pa'i phyir med pa bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, when that reason is endowed with a valid cognition, it is contradictory to itself. Therefore, the non-existent is to be proven.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na de la 'di gnod pa can ma grub na the tshom za ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na de la 'di gnod pa can ma grub na the tshom za ba ni bzlog par dka'o //
translated: Otherwise, if it is not established as a contradiction, then it is difficult to reverse the doubt.

original: dngos po ma dmigs pa thams cad ni gnod pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po ma dmigs pa thams cad ni gnod pa can ma yin te /
translated: All non-perceptions of things are not contradictions.

original: de la nus pa ni rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nus pa ni rim dang cig car gyis khyab pa grub pa yin te /
translated: The power of the reason is established by pervasion through sequence and simultaneity.

original: rnam pa gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other way.

original: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i chos ma dmigs pas skad cig ma ma yin pa la nus pa la gnod pa can yin pa'i phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa la ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab par byed pa'i chos ma dmigs pas skad cig ma ma yin pa la nus pa la gnod pa can yin pa'i phyir rim dang cig car mi rigs pa la ni /
translated: Therefore, since the non-observation of the pervader is a counter-pervasion with regard to non-momentariness, sequence and simultaneity are not tenable.

original: nus pa med pas khyab par grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nus pa med pas khyab par grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is established that the absence of power is pervaded by that.

original: thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of infinite regress does not follow.

original: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dag ni sgrub pa'i yan lag bsgrubs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba dag ni sgrub pa'i yan lag bsgrubs pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, in the application of reasons of nature, the established branches of proof are established.

original: de la bsgrubs pa med pa ni sgrub pa'i yan lag mi smra ba'i rgol ba de ni pham pa'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: de la bsgrubs pa med pa ni sgrub pa'i yan lag mi smra ba'i rgol ba de ni pham pa'i gnas yin te /
translated: In that regard, the non-establishment of the established is a ground for defeat for the proponent who does not state the branches of proof.

original: rtsom pa'i don rab tu ma bsgrubs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i don rab tu ma bsgrubs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of the composition is not well established.

original: dngos po la sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs khas len du zin kyang nus pa rab tu ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs khas len du zin kyang nus pa rab tu ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one accepts the reason of establishment in reality, the power is not well demonstrated.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang sgrub pa'i yan lag tu bsgrubs pa ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyang sgrub pa'i yan lag tu bsgrubs pa ni /
translated: The reason based on effect is also established as a part of the proof.

original: 'bras bu'i rtags rgyu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rtags rgyu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The reason based on effect is for the sake of proving the cause.

original: nye bar blangs pa gang @328a * //
analyzed: nye bar blangs pa gang @328a * //
translated: Whatever is accepted

original: yin pa de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: yin pa de dang lhan cig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por sgrub pa ni /
translated: is established as the relation of cause and effect with that.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag gis rab tu grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma dag gis rab tu grub ste /
translated: This is well established by the valid cognitions that prove things and non-things.

original: dper na 'di yod na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: dper na 'di yod na 'di 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: For example, when this exists, that arises.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa'i rgyu dag yod du zin kyang de med na med par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nus pa'i rgyu dag yod du zin kyang de med na med par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: Even if other potential causes exist, if that does not exist, it does not occur.

original: de ltar na ni 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du the tshom med par bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du the tshom med par bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there is no doubt that this is established as its effect.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na de med na med do zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na de med na med do zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig nye bar bstan na /
translated: Otherwise, if it is shown that without that, it does not exist,

original: de las gzhan yod na yang 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'di'i nus pa la the tshom za zhing de la gzhan gyi nus pa med na de mi 'byung ba ni /üîΩde ldog na yang ldog pa 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur te ma pag mar len pa'i yul du phin ma khar  rdzu ra skye'o /
analyzed: de las gzhan yod na yang 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'di'i nus pa la the tshom za zhing de la gzhan gyi nus pa med na de mi 'byung ba ni / de ldog na yang ldog pa 'dod rgyal bar 'gyur te ma pag mar len pa'i yul du phin ma khar  rdzu ra skye'o /
translated: If there were any other, then this would be doubted as to its power, and if there were no other power, it would not occur.

original: ma bag mar len pa med pa'i yul gzhan du med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma bag mar len pa med pa'i yul gzhan du med pa lta bu'o //
translated: And if it were to cease, its cessation would be capricious, like the birth of a child to a barren woman in a place where there are no men, or the non-birth of a child to a barren woman in a place where there are men.

original: de ltar bsgrubs na de de'i 'bras bur grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrubs na de de'i 'bras bur grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when it is established in this way, it is established as the effect of that.

original: grub pa yang rang yod na de yod bar sgrub par byed pa ni /
analyzed: grub pa yang rang yod na de yod bar sgrub par byed pa ni /
translated: And when it is established, the proof that it exists when there is that is

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no error in cause and effect.

original: ma 'khrul par yang rang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad 'dra ba ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'khrul par yang rang gi rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad 'dra ba ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: And when there is no error, it is reasonable that all causes and effects are similar.

original: de ltar ma bsgrubs na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi'ang sgrub pa'i yan lag kyang mi brjod pa'i rgol ba de ni pham pa'i gnas yin no//
analyzed: de ltar ma bsgrubs na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi'ang sgrub pa'i yan lag kyang mi brjod pa'i rgol ba de ni pham pa'i gnas yin no//
translated: If it is not established in this way, then the opponent who does not state even the branch of the probandum in the case of a proof by effect is in a position of defeat.

original: ma bsgrubs shing 'bras bu ma grub par de ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs der ma grub pas /
analyzed: ma bsgrubs shing 'bras bu ma grub par de ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs der ma grub pas /
translated: Since it is not established as a reason for the effect, it is not established in that regard.

original: don gzhan de'i dngos po dang 'brel ba med pa'i rang bzhin la ni /
analyzed: don gzhan de'i dngos po dang 'brel ba med pa'i rang bzhin la ni /
translated: The nature of a thing that is not related to another thing

original: yod na de yod pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na de yod pa'i nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not ascertained to exist if the other exists.

original: brtsams pa'i don ma grub pas dngos su 'bras bu'i rtags khas blangs pa yang ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtsams pa'i don ma grub pas dngos su 'bras bu'i rtags khas blangs pa yang ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the point of the composition is not established, the reason of the effect is not taught explicitly.

original: mi dmigs pa la yang rtogs pa pos dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don ma dmigs pa ni sgrub par byed pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa la yang rtogs pa pos dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don ma dmigs pa ni sgrub par byed pa bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: As for non-observation, if the observer does not observe an object that is suitable to be observed, then the proof is established.

original: de 'dra ba kho na'i mi dmigs pa las ni med pa 'grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba kho na'i mi dmigs pa las ni med pa 'grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Non-existence is established from just such a non-observation.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma grub pa sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log pas kyang med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar ma grub pa sgrub pa po'i mngon sum log pas kyang med pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But non-existence is not established by the mere absence of the direct perception of the prover.

original: de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don ni /
translated: An object that is suitable to be observed

original: rang bzhin khyad par khyad par can dang rgyu gzhan tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par khyad par can dang rgyu gzhan tshogs pa'o //
translated: is the collection of the nature, the particular, and the other causes.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can ni gang bskal pa rnam pa gsum gyis ma bskal pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i snang ba dang bral @328b pa ;
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can ni gang bskal pa rnam pa gsum gyis ma bskal pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa'i snang ba dang bral @328b pa ;
translated: The special nature is that which is not unobservable by the three types of eons, the nature that is free from the appearance of being other than itself.

original: sgrub pa po'i mngon du snang ba'i ngo bo de 'dra ba yod pa dmigs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzhan dag de ltar ma dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mngon du snang ba'i ngo bo de 'dra ba yod pa dmigs pa'i rgyur gyur pa gzhan dag de ltar ma dmigs pa ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no //
translated: The object of the term nonexistence is that which is not observed as the cause of the appearance of the nature of the object of the yogi.

original: de las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i rtags ni the tshom yin la /
analyzed: de las rnam pa gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i rtags ni the tshom yin la /
translated: The sign of the nonexistence of something else is doubt.

original: 'dir yang rnam pa de lta bu yod pa thams cad ni med pa'i thams cad kyi yul yin no zhes bya bas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam pa de lta bu yod pa thams cad ni med pa'i thams cad kyi yul yin no zhes bya bas khyab pa yin te /
translated: And here, all that has such an aspect is the object of the term all nonexistents.

original: 'ga' zhig med par khas blangs pa la gzhan de'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig med par khas blangs pa la gzhan de'i mtshan nyid khyad par med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when one accepts the nonexistence of something, the other, which has the same characteristics, is not different.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i med pa khas mi len na gzhan du de'i 'brel pa med de /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i med pa khas mi len na gzhan du de'i 'brel pa med de /
translated: If one does not accept such a nonexistence, it is not related to the other.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa yod cing gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen dag yod na ma dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa yod cing gzhan dmigs pa'i rkyen dag yod na ma dmigs pa med do //
translated: If such a form exists and the other conditions for perception are present, then the non-perception of it does not exist.

original: 'di 'dra ba ma dmigs pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ma dmigs pa ni med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the non-perception of such a form is non-existence.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni de tsam yin te /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ni de tsam yin te /
translated: This is the reason for the convention of non-existence.

original: gzhan de'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan de'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other reason for it.

original: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis dpen ba rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa thams cad kyis dpen ba rgyu mtshan yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason is the absence of all capacity,

original: de ni de ltar yin na nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa de de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni de ltar yin na nus pa thams cad kyis dben pa de de ltar rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: then if that were so, the absence of all capacity would be understood in that way.

original: de rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtogs pa'i thabs gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other means of understanding it.

original: de rtogs pa yang yod na med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni de'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de rtogs pa yang yod na med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni de'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin no //
translated: And if that is understood, then the convention of non-existence would occur. Therefore this is stated as the reason for that.

original: gal te blo dang sgra dang don byed pa dag yod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: gal te blo dang sgra dang don byed pa dag yod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
translated: If you say that the conventions of existence are the existence of cognition, words, and the performance of functions,

original: bzlog pa ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no zhe na /
translated: and the convention of non-existence is the opposite of that,

original: ci skad du bshad pa'i blo'i snang ba las ni yod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: ci skad du bshad pa'i blo'i snang ba las ni yod pa'i tha snyad yin la /
translated: The conventional expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù is due to the appearance of an awareness as explained above.

original: bzlog pa de'i yul ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa de'i yul ni med pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: The conventional expression ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is the opposite of that.

original: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa rtags 'ga' zhig las skyes pa las kyang yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pa rtags 'ga' zhig las skyes pa las kyang yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur la /
translated: The conventional expression ‚Äúexists‚Äù also arises from some evidence that is not the object of perception.

original: med pa'i tha snyad ni de bzlog pa lam nges pa yin te /üîΩbskal pa'i don la rtogs pa po'i mngon sum mam /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad ni de bzlog pa lam nges pa yin te / bskal pa'i don la rtogs pa po'i mngon sum mam /
translated: The conventional expression ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is the opposite of that.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is not a real object, then it is a mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.

original: gzhan gyi tshad ma log na the tshom yin no blo dang sgra thams cad kyi de tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med pas /üîΩdngos po yod pa'am /üîΩdngos po tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshad ma log na the tshom yin no blo dang sgra thams cad kyi de tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med pas / dngos po yod pa'am / dngos po tha dad pa'am /
translated: If the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.

original: tha dad pa med pa yod pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa yod pa sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.üîΩIf the object of a conceptual consciousness is a real object, then it is a non mistaken consciousness.

original: ci ltar yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba la sogs pa med pa dag dang / sna tshogs pa'i don gyi bya ba dang / gcig gi don gyi bya ba byed pa dag la /
analyzed: ci ltar yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs ba la sogs pa med pa dag dang / sna tshogs pa'i don gyi bya ba dang / gcig gi don gyi bya ba byed pa dag la /
translated: If the

original: sna tshogs pa dang / gcig gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po med kyang de nyid gsal bar @329a * //üîΩbya ba'i don du /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang / gcig gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po med kyang de nyid gsal bar @329a * // bya ba'i don du /

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po med kyang de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i don du /

analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin dag 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.

original: dper na rgyal po mang pos bkur ba rgyal rigs rab tu skrun par byed pa mang pos bkur bas sprul pa'i mchod sdong 'khor los sgyur ba dung gis 'degs par 'gyur pa nyid dang / ri bong gi rva dag dang / gzugs bstan du yod pa dang /
analyzed: dper na rgyal po mang pos bkur ba rgyal rigs rab tu skrun par byed pa mang pos bkur bas sprul pa'i mchod sdong 'khor los sgyur ba dung gis 'degs par 'gyur pa nyid dang / ri bong gi rva dag dang / gzugs bstan du yod pa dang /
translated: For example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,

analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o // bstan du yod pa la sogs pa'i sgra ni /
translated: the nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,üîΩthe nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.

original: dngos po sna tshogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po sna tshogs pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: For example, although there is no entity that is both manifold and unitary, in order to make that known,

original: gcig la nye bar 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la nye bar 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the nature of both the manifold and the unitary is engaged.üîΩFor example, although there is no entity that is

original: gal te yul sna tshogs su zin kyang gcig la nye bar bsdu ba de'i rgyu mtshan ni /
analyzed: gal te yul sna tshogs su zin kyang gcig la nye bar bsdu ba de'i rgyu mtshan ni /
translated: If, although the object is various, it is collected into one, the reason for that is

original: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because of its connection.üîΩOh, how difficult it is to be connected with the various sounds of the word ‚Äúself‚Äù by the attachment to the entity of the suffering of asceticism!

original: ae ma'o dka' thub sdug bsngal gyi dngos po la zhen pas 'brel pa can du ma nye bar byed cing bdag nyid kyi sgra sna tshogs pa de dag las 'dod cing de nus pa'i bye brag gang gis 'brel pa can sna tshogs byed pa bas de nyid kyis
analyzed: ae ma'o dka' thub sdug bsngal gyi dngos po la zhen pas 'brel pa can du ma nye bar byed cing bdag nyid kyi sgra sna tshogs pa de dag las 'dod cing de nus pa'i bye brag gang gis 'brel pa can sna tshogs byed pa bas de nyid kyis
translated: By what particular capacity is it that one makes various connections?üîΩBy that very thing,

original: sgra sna tshogs ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs ci'i phyir skyed par mi byed /
translated: why does it not produce various sounds?

original: de ltar na 'dis brgyud pas 'jug pa'i du ba pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis brgyud pas 'jug pa'i du ba pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would completely abandon the inference of smoke.

original: sgra sna tshogs skyed bar byed pa'i nus pa med na ni /
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs skyed bar byed pa'i nus pa med na ni /
translated: If there is no capacity to produce various sounds,

original: 'brel pa can sna tshogs nye bar byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can sna tshogs nye bar byed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not make various connections.

original: de dag la nye bar byed pa med pa yin na yang de'i 'brel pa can nyid kyang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de dag la nye bar byed pa med pa yin na yang de'i 'brel pa can nyid kyang mi 'grub po //
translated: Even if there is no making of connections, its connection would not be established.

original: bum pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang gzugs la sogs pa nyid don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa la bum pa'i sgra gcig brjod par 'gyur pa yin te don gzhan la rtog pa ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: bum pa zhes bya ba 'di la yang gzugs la sogs pa nyid don gyi bya ba gcig byed pa la bum pa'i sgra gcig brjod par 'gyur pa yin te don gzhan la rtog pa ci zhig dgos /
translated: In the case of the word pot, the word pot is used to refer to a single object that performs a single function, such as a visible form. What need is there to imagine other objects?

original: mang po yin du zin kyang don gyi bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mang po yin du zin kyang don gyi bya ba gcig byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there are many, they will perform a single function,

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: just like the eye and so on.

original: de'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir de la sgra gcig nges par sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir de la sgra gcig nges par sbyor bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pa yang mthong ngo //
translated: It is reasonable to see that the word pot is used to refer to a single object in order to indicate its capacity.

original: 'jig rten ba ni dgos pa med par don la sgra sbyor bar mi byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten ba ni dgos pa med par don la sgra sbyor bar mi byed do //
translated: People do not use words to refer to objects without purpose.

original: de la don gang yin pa lhan cig gam tha dad pa de dag gi dgos pa gcig pa de'i dngos po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe sgra gcig sbyor ba na cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de la don gang yin pa lhan cig gam tha dad pa de dag gi dgos pa gcig pa de'i dngos po gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gang gi tshe sgra gcig sbyor ba na cir 'gyur /
translated: In that case, whether the object is simultaneous or different, if the purpose of those is the same, then when a single word is used to indicate the entity of that, what is the purpose of using a word?

original: de rnams kyi don gcig byed pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyi don gcig byed pa'i nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to indicate the capacity to perform a single function of those.

original: sgra de rnams nges par @329b sbyor ba spyi'i sgra tshig gcig pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra de rnams nges par @329b sbyor ba spyi'i sgra tshig gcig pa 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: These words are certainly not contradictory when they are used in a general way.

original: lhan cig pa de dag gi nus pa de yang gcig yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig pa de dag gi nus pa de yang gcig yin gyi /
translated: The power of these co-existent things is one,

original: so so'i ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩtshogs pa'i sgra'am /
analyzed: so so'i ni ma yin no zhe na / tshogs pa'i sgra'am /
translated: not separate.

original: tshogs pa gcig gi brjod bya la tshig gcig pa yin te /üîΩbum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig gi brjod bya la tshig gcig pa yin te / bum pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used to refer to a single collection.üîΩThe word ‚Äúvase‚Äù is used to refer to a single collection.

original: rigs kyi sgra rnams la don rnams re re dang lhan cig pa'i nus pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi sgra rnams la don rnams re re dang lhan cig pa'i nus pa ste /
translated: The words of a class have the power to refer to each individual thing.

original: gcig dang du ma'i nus pa zhes bya ba la gcig dang du ma'i nus pa brjod par 'dod na mang po'i tshig can dang / gcig gi tshig can 'dod pas /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i nus pa zhes bya ba la gcig dang du ma'i nus pa brjod par 'dod na mang po'i tshig can dang / gcig gi tshig can 'dod pas /
translated: If one wishes to express the power of the individual and the power of the collection, one uses the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù and the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: shing rnams zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing rnams zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äútrees‚Äù is used.

original: gang la 'di'i nges pa ni mang po dag la mang po'i tshig dang gcig la gcig gi tshig sbyar nya bar bya na /
analyzed: gang la 'di'i nges pa ni mang po dag la mang po'i tshig dang gcig la gcig gi tshig sbyar nya bar bya na /
translated: If one wishes to apply the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù to many and the word ‚Äúone‚Äù to one,üîΩthen the word ‚Äútrees‚Äù is used.

original: kho bo cag gi brdar btags pa'i don dag la brda'i dbang gis rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi brdar btags pa'i don dag la brda'i dbang gis rab tu 'jug pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: We are not attached to the objects that are designated by convention, because we engage with them by the power of convention.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa gcig dang sna tshogs pa la sgra gcig kun nas snang ba'i nus pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa gcig dang sna tshogs pa la sgra gcig kun nas snang ba'i nus pa yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the word has the power to manifest a single form, etc., and a variety,

original: skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos pa med par don gyis sgra kun nas snang bar byed pa yin nam /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'jug pa la ltos pa med par don gyis sgra kun nas snang bar byed pa yin nam /
translated: then does the word manifest the object without depending on the engagement of a person?

original: 'on te skyes bu dag gis don dag la tha snyad kyi don du sgra sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te skyes bu dag gis don dag la tha snyad kyi don du sgra sbyor ba yin /
translated: Or do people apply the word to the object for the purpose of designation?

original: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa ni dngos po la nus pa yod dam med bsam par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: rang kun nas slong bar byed pa ni dngos po la nus pa yod dam med bsam par bya ba yin na /
translated: One should consider whether the power to motivate is in the thing or not.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is also unreasonable.

original: skyes bus de dag la nye bar sbyor na de dag ji ltar 'dod pas nges par sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir de la skyon ci yod /
analyzed: skyes bus de dag la nye bar sbyor na de dag ji ltar 'dod pas nges par sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir de la skyon ci yod /
translated: If people apply them, then what is wrong with applying them as they wish, since they are not fixed by nature?

original: rgyu mtshan yang nges par sbyor ba bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan yang nges par sbyor ba bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The reason is that the application is taught to be fixed.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag sgra gcig dang 'grel pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag sgra gcig dang 'grel pa ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if form and so on are not related to a single word,

original: de dag gi rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i rjes gcig dang ji ltar 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rten du mngon par 'dod pa'i rjes gcig dang ji ltar 'brel ba yin te /
translated: how are they related to a single basis, which is asserted to be their support?

original: don med pa'i zhe na pa kho na'o //
analyzed: don med pa'i zhe na pa kho na'o //
translated: It is just a useless assertion.

original: kho bo ni gcig dang 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir sgra gcig mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kho bo ni gcig dang 'brel pa 'gal ba'i phyir sgra gcig mi 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: We do not assert that a single word is incompatible with being related to a single basis.

original: 'on kyang bum pa dang la bal stsogs pa gzugs la sogs par tha dad pa med pa dag ni don tha dad pa byed pa dang sgra 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang bum pa dang la bal stsogs pa gzugs la sogs par tha dad pa med pa dag ni don tha dad pa byed pa dang sgra 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: However, a vase, woolen cloth, and so on are not different from form and so on, because it is contradictory that they perform different functions and have different names.

original: de rnams rang bzhin gcig pa rnams tshogs pa gzhan yod pa la don gyi bya ba byed ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams rang bzhin gcig pa rnams tshogs pa gzhan yod pa la don gyi bya ba byed ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: A collection of things that are the same nature does not perform the function of a different object.

original: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i ched du sgra gcig gis brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bstan pa'i ched du sgra gcig gis brjod par mi bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, they should not be expressed by a single word.

original: tshogs pa thams cad dag gi gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig dag tu 'gyur ro zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig 'dod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: tshogs pa thams cad dag gi gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gcig dag tu 'gyur ro zhes 'dir 'ga' zhig 'dod par 'gyur na /
translated: If someone asserts that all collections of form and so on become a single nature,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba tshogs pa'i @330a * //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba tshogs pa'i @330a * //
translated: A collection of mutually contradictory things

original: gzugs snang ba mngon sum du mthong na ci ste btang snyoms su byed /
analyzed: gzugs snang ba mngon sum du mthong na ci ste btang snyoms su byed /
translated: If you directly see a visible form, why would you remain indifferent?

original: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is also not the case,

original: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi tshogs pa so so'i rang bzhin tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa dag gi tshogs pa so so'i rang bzhin tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that the collection of visible forms, etc., has a different nature from each individual member.

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan bum pa zhes bya ba gcig nyid du 'gyur na cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa dag las gzhan bum pa zhes bya ba gcig nyid du 'gyur na cir 'gyur /
translated: In this way, if something called a ‚Äúpot‚Äù were different from visible forms, etc., and were a single entity, what would follow?

original: 'gyur na de mngon sum du yod de /
analyzed: 'gyur na de mngon sum du yod de /
translated: If it followed, it would be directly perceptible,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa blo la rang gi ngo bor snang la rag na cis bsgribs pa yin /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa blo la rang gi ngo bor snang la rag na cis bsgribs pa yin /
translated: because it would have a different nature from visible forms, etc., and would appear to the mind in its own nature. What would obstruct it?

original: so sor snang ba tha dad par mngon sum la yul tha dad pa med kyang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i don dang / de bzhin du grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg bya la sogs pa dbang po gcig gi yul yin du zin kyang tha dad par snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba tha dad par mngon sum la yul tha dad pa med kyang dri dang ro la sogs pa'i don dang / de bzhin du grang ba dang tsha ba'i reg bya la sogs pa dbang po gcig gi yul yin du zin kyang tha dad par snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Although there is no difference in the object, individual appearances are different. For example, smell, taste, and so on are the objects of the nose, tongue, and so on, and likewise, cold, hot touch, and so on are the objects of a single sense faculty, but they appear as different.

original: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa tha dad pas rang gi ngo bo blo la gzhag pa 'di nyid kyang mngon sum gyis mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin pa tha dad pas rang gi ngo bo blo la gzhag pa 'di nyid kyang mngon sum gyis mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: And this very positing of the nature of the object in the mind, by means of something different from the nature of the object, is also a direct perception.

original: bum pa 'di yang rin byin pa med par 'tshang ba ni rang gi ngo bo ston pa med par yang mngon sum nyid du khas len par 'dod do //
analyzed: bum pa 'di yang rin byin pa med par 'tshang ba ni rang gi ngo bo ston pa med par yang mngon sum nyid du khas len par 'dod do //
translated: And this pot, even without being given a price, is accepted as being directly perceived, even without showing its nature.

original: de dag gis blo dang sgra tha dad pa la sogs pa yin yang sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis blo dang sgra tha dad pa la sogs pa yin yang sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: And although the mind and the word are different, etc., this has been explained previously.

original: gal te de dag gis de sgrub par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te de dag gis de sgrub par 'dod na /
translated: If they want to prove that,

original: mngon sum nyams pa med par gzugs ma mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyams pa med par gzugs ma mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: it is not that the form is not seen without the impairment of direct perception.

original: gang gis de sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de sgrub par byed pa'i rtags brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should state the reason that proves that.

original: mngon sum nyid med pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid med pa la /
translated: In the absence of direct perception,

original: mngon sum nyid med du zin kyang blo dang sgra tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag la gzhan bum pa dag ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid med du zin kyang blo dang sgra tha dad pa dang ldan pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag la gzhan bum pa dag ces bya ba ni ma yin te /
translated: even though there is no direct perception, the forms, etc. that possess the difference of mind and word are not other things called pots,

original: sngar sun phyung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar sun phyung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they have already been refuted.

original: de ltar na de srid du blo dang sgra dag gis yod pa'i tha snyad dam /
analyzed: de ltar na de srid du blo dang sgra dag gis yod pa'i tha snyad dam /
translated: Thus, as long as the mind and words do not function to produce an effect, they do not produce the convention ‚Äúexists‚Äù or the convention ‚Äúdoes not exist.‚Äù

original: yod pa nyid tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te /üîΩde ldog pa las de ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te / de ldog pa las de ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor do they produce the convention ‚Äúis different‚Äù or ‚Äúis not different.‚Äù

original: don byed pa las ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don byed pa las ni yod pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur gyi /
translated: But when they do function to produce an effect, then they do produce the convention ‚Äúexists.‚Äù

original: de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor do they produce the convention ‚Äúis different‚Äù or ‚Äúis not different.‚Äù

original: gcig la yang don du ma byed pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig la yang don du ma byed pa mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: For we see that even a single thing does not produce all effects,

original: dper na mar me gcig gis rnam par shes pa dang / sdod bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'bar ba gzhan bskyed pa lta bu dang / mig la sogs pa du mas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed pa @330b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mar me gcig gis rnam par shes pa dang / sdod bu'i rnam par 'gyur ba dang / 'bar ba gzhan bskyed pa lta bu dang / mig la sogs pa du mas kyang rnam par shes pa gcig bskyed pa @330b mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: just as a single lamp illuminates and produces a flame and a shadow, and many eyes together produce a single visual consciousness.

original: don byed pa tha dad pa tsam gyis yod pa nyid tha dad pa zhes smra bar ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: don byed pa tha dad pa tsam gyis yod pa nyid tha dad pa zhes smra bar ni mi bya'i /
translated: One should not say that the difference in the production of effects is itself the difference in existence.

original: 'on kyang mthong pa'i don byed pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas don byed pa de la ma mthong ba yang de las gzhan du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid tha dad pa sgrub par byed de dper na snam bu la chu 'dzin pa laüîΩstsogs pa'i don gyi bya ba ma mthong la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong pa'i don byed pa tha dad pa'i sgo nas don byed pa de la ma mthong ba yang de las gzhan du mthong ba gang yin pa de ni yod pa nyid tha dad pa sgrub par byed de dper na snam bu la chu 'dzin pa la stsogs pa'i don gyi bya ba ma mthong la /
translated: For example, in a cloth, the function of holding water, etc. is not seen,

original: bum pa la mthong ba dang snal ma dag la gos la sogs pa'i bya ba ma mthong la /
analyzed: bum pa la mthong ba dang snal ma dag la gos la sogs pa'i bya ba ma mthong la /
translated: but in a pot, it is seen. In threads, the function of cloth, etc. is not seen,

original: snam bu la mthong ngo zhes bya ba yod pa nyid tha dad pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: snam bu la mthong ngo zhes bya ba yod pa nyid tha dad pa'o zhe na /
translated: but in a cloth, it is seen. Thus, existence is different.

original: de ltar don gzhan grub pa ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar don gzhan grub pa ni yod mod kyi /
translated: Although the establishment of difference in meaning is indeed so,

original: de ltar yang yan lag can ni grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang yan lag can ni grub pa ma yin te /
translated: nevertheless, the whole is not established.

original: dper na rkyen gyis 'dus byas pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na rkyen gyis 'dus byas pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, because the nature of the continuum that is conditioned by conditions produces difference,

original: don byed pa tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa tha dad pa yin te /
translated: the performance of different functions is different.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa las me spra ba dang / rta spangs dang / rtsva dang / shing bsregs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa de bzhin du rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs tha dad pa las me spra ba dang / rta spangs dang / rtsva dang / shing bsregs pa'i nus pa tha dad pa de bzhin du rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rang bzhin tha dad pa skyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as fire, which is different from the different stages of the rubbing of the kindling stick, has the different capacities to burn straw, horse-dung, grass, and wood, in the same way, because it produces different natures according to the conditions,

original: snal ma la sogs pa de dag gi don gyi bya ba tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: snal ma la sogs pa de dag gi don gyi bya ba tha dad pa'o //
translated: the different functions of the threads, etc. are different.

original: de dag gis blo dang sgra'i tha dad pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis blo dang sgra'i tha dad pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: They explain the difference of the cognition and the word in this way.

original: de la don byed pa las yod pa nyid kyi tha snyad sgrub par smras pa gang yin pa la log pas kyang ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni bden no //
analyzed: de la don byed pa las yod pa nyid kyi tha snyad sgrub par smras pa gang yin pa la log pas kyang ldog pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni bden no //
translated: In this regard, it is true that what was said, ‚ÄúThe convention of existence is established from the performance of a function,‚Äù is refuted by the refutation.

original: log pa de nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa dag gis ma grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log pa de nyid kyis dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa dag gis ma grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that very refutation, those that are not perceived are not established.

original: der 'di yod du zin kyang mi 'dod na yang grub pa yin te /
analyzed: der 'di yod du zin kyang mi 'dod na yang grub pa yin te /
translated: Even if it were to exist there, if it is not accepted, it is established.

original: nus pa 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dmigs par ma gyur na de ni me dpa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: nus pa 'di dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa dmigs par ma gyur na de ni me dpa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: If this potency is not perceived, then it is the object of the convention ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Existence‚Äù

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is the characteristic of potency.

original: de ltar na yang snga ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: de ltar na yang snga ma las 'di khyad par ci yod /
translated: But what is the difference between this and the previous [position]?

original: de rang bzhin las don gzhan ni nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rang bzhin las don gzhan ni nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Potency is not something different from the nature [of the object].

original: de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de mi dmigs pa gang yin te /
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa de mi dmigs pa gang yin te /
translated: It is the non-perception of that which is perceptible.

original: snga ma kho na mi dmigs pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: snga ma kho na mi dmigs pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is just the non-perception mentioned earlier.

original: de'i phyir 'dis 'ga' zhig tu med pa'i tha snyad khas len na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis 'ga' zhig tu med pa'i tha snyad khas len na /
translated: Therefore, if one accepts the convention ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù in some cases,

original: ma dmigs pa las khas blang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ma dmigs pa las khas blang bar bya ba'am /
translated: one must accept it on the basis of non-perception.

original: 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin te khyad par med ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu yang ma yin te khyad par med ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is not [accepted] in any case, because there is no distinction.

original: de gzhan du yang de lta bu'i rnam pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de yang de ltar yod do zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de gzhan du yang de lta bu'i rnam pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de yang de ltar yod do zhes bya ba ni khyab pa ste /
translated: And because there is no distinction in the features of that [object] in other cases, it exists in that way. This is the pervasion.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu thams cad ni med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: All such non-observation is the domain of the term non-existence.

original: @331a * // gal te 'ga' zhig tu rnam pa ji ltar ma dmigs su zin kyang /
analyzed: @331a * // gal te 'ga' zhig tu rnam pa ji ltar ma dmigs su zin kyang /
translated: If someone says that even though one does not observe a form in a certain way,

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul ma yin no zhe na /
translated: it is not the domain of the term non-existence,

original: thams cad thams cad kyi tshe gzugs thams cad thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad kyi tshe gzugs thams cad thams cad du thams cad kyi tshe don byed pa yin te /
translated: then all forms would always and in every way perform a function in all places and times.

original: 'di ni 'di las yin la 'di las ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di las yin la 'di las ma yin /
translated: This would be so because it would not be possible to say, ‚ÄúThis is from this, but not from that.

original: 'di ni 'di na yin gyi 'di na ma yin 'di'i tshe yin gyi 'di'i tshe ma yin /üîΩ'di ni de lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di na yin gyi 'di na ma yin 'di'i tshe yin gyi 'di'i tshe ma yin / 'di ni de lta bu yin gyi /
translated: This is here, but not there. This is at this time, but not at that time.

original: 'di ma yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩgzugs 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa ji ltar yang tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ma yin zhes bya ba 'dir yang mi 'gyur te / gzugs 'ga' zhig tu 'ga' zhig gi tshe rnam pa ji ltar yang tha dad pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir thams cad rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: This is like this, but not like that.‚ÄùüîΩThis is because there would be no cause for differentiating a form in any way at all, anywhere, at any time.

original: dngos po la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Everything would be without exclusion and without inclusion because there would be no difference in things.

original: gnas skabs ldog pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa tha dad pa bdag gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe na de nyid yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir de yang med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs ldog pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa tha dad pa bdag gis rnam par gzhag pa yin no zhe na de nyid yul thams cad la med pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir de yang med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of all objects is established by the nonexistence of a single object, then that itself is not, because there is no convention of the nonexistence of all objects.

original: gang gi phyir de dag las rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag las rnam par gzhag par 'gyur /
translated: For what reason would it be established from those?

original: yul 'ga' zhig la med pa'i tha snyad khas len na /
analyzed: yul 'ga' zhig la med pa'i tha snyad khas len na /
translated: If you accept the convention of the nonexistence of some object,

original: de gang gis byas pa yin no zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: de gang gis byas pa yin no zhes brjod par bya /
translated: then you must say, ‚ÄúIt is done by this.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no reason for exclusion other than nonapprehension.

original: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis rnam par gcod pa ni thams cad mi dmigs pa kho nas sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gis rnam par gcod pa ni thams cad mi dmigs pa kho nas sgrub par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all exclusion by affirmation and negation is established by nonapprehension alone.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid las de khas len pa de gang na yod pa de thams cad med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid las de khas len pa de gang na yod pa de thams cad med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin no zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: You must say that the object of the convention of nonexistence is all that exists, which is excluded by nonapprehension.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: gal te tshad ma thams cad log pa'i mi dmigs pa de gang na yod pa de med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma thams cad log pa'i mi dmigs pa de gang na yod pa de med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul yin par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that the non-apprehension of all valid cognitions is the object of the expression ‚Äúnon-existence of that which exists there,‚ÄùüîΩthen you are a person of very young intelligence, who is not able to bear the affliction of the analysis of valid cognitions, which delights the gods.

original: shes rab shin tu gzhon pa lha rnams dga' ba tshad ma rnam par dpyod pa'i nyon mongs pa mi bzod pa gang gis 'di la gus par mi byed pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ldog pas med pa khong du chud pa med de 'khrul
analyzed: shes rab shin tu gzhon pa lha rnams dga' ba tshad ma rnam par dpyod pa'i nyon mongs pa mi bzod pa gang gis 'di la gus par mi byed pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa ldog pas med pa khong du chud pa med de 'khrul
translated: Because of the reversal of inference, etc., you do not understand non-existence, since you do not respect it.

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of error.

original: thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ni ma grub pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: thams cad kyi mngon sum log pa ni ma grub pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The reversal of all direct perception is not established.

original: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mngon sum log pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reversal of one‚Äôs own direct perception,

original: bskal pa dag la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa dag la yang the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one doubts even in the case of kalpas.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par de tshad ma gang las mngon sum du yod pa'i tha snyad thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par de tshad ma gang las mngon sum du yod pa'i tha snyad thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, from what valid cognition does one obtain the conventional existence of that particular intrinsic nature?

original: de ldog pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de ldog pa nyid ni /
translated: And the reversal of that

original: de ldog pa nyid kyis de med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ldog pa nyid kyis de med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed do //
translated: establishes the conventional non-existence of that by the reversal of that.

original: de'i rang bzhin @331b yod pa de la /üîΩtshad ma yod pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin @331b yod pa de la / tshad ma yod pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of its intrinsic reality is necessarily concomitant with the existence of a valid cognition.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don gyi mngon sum las gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa'i don gyi mngon sum las gzhan gyis dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The object that is the perceptual basis is perceived by direct perception, not by inference.

original: gang gis na rjes su dpag pa'i dmigs pas yin /
analyzed: gang gis na rjes su dpag pa'i dmigs pas yin /
translated: By what inference is the perceptual basis perceived?

original: de'i rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur na mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gzhan du ma gyur na mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If its intrinsic reality does not change, it is not that it does not become direct perception.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yod na yang de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yod na yang de nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it exists in another aspect, it does not become that.

original: gzhan yang sman dang sngags med par mig 'phrul mkhan gyis 'di dngos por slob pa ni gang gi 'dir ma skyes shing 'jig pa med pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par chod pa med pa dang / ring po ma yin pa gnas pa can nyid ni skyes bu de nyid kyi dbang po la sogs pa de bzhin du gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum dang /üîΩmngon sum ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan yang sman dang sngags med par mig 'phrul mkhan gyis 'di dngos por slob pa ni gang gi 'dir ma skyes shing 'jig pa med pa'i ngo bo'i khyad par chod pa med pa dang / ring po ma yin pa gnas pa can nyid ni skyes bu de nyid kyi dbang po la sogs pa de bzhin du gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi tshe mngon sum dang / mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, without medicine and mantra, how can the magician train in this as a real thing? Here, the uninterrupted, non-distant, enduring nature of the unarisen and undestroyed essence is the very same person whose faculties and so forth remain just as they were. At some time, it becomes direct perception and at some time, it does not become direct perception.

original: gang gis 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
analyzed: gang gis 'ga' zhig gi tshe /
translated: By what is it that at some time,üîΩit becomes direct perception?

original: 'di rjes su dpag pas dmigs shing 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: 'di rjes su dpag pas dmigs shing 'ga' zhig tu mngon sum yin la /
translated: It is perceived by inference, and in some cases it is perceived by direct perception.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe lung yin na khyad par med pa de nyid la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe lung yin na khyad par med pa de nyid la /
translated: If it is scripture in some cases, there is no difference.

original: rnam pa de dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those aspects are contradictory.

original: khyad par med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not without difference,

original: khyad par gcig ldog pa dang khyad par gzhan skye bas tha snyad kyi bye brag nye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gcig ldog pa dang khyad par gzhan skye bas tha snyad kyi bye brag nye bar khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the difference is accepted as a particular convention through the cessation of one difference and the arising of another difference.

original: khyad par de de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa ldog pa dang / 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: khyad par de de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa rjes su 'gro ba med pa ldog pa dang / 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If that difference becomes its own nature, without following, it is cessation and engagement.

original: ji ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin sna tshogs pa 'dren par mi byed /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin sna tshogs pa 'dren par mi byed /
translated: How does it not bring about the variety of natures of things?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal lta bu'o //
translated: Like pleasure and pain.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Even if it has following,

original: gang gi ci rab tu 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi ci rab tu 'jug pa'am /
translated: what is it that engages or ceases?

original: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni gang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ni gang yang ma yin no //
translated: That is nothing at all.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rang nyid rab tu 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rjes su shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar rang bzhin 'ga' zhig rang nyid rab tu 'jug pa dang / ldog pa rjes su shes pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that some nature itself is engaged and

original: gzhan de nyid smra ba la ci'i phyir khas mi len /
analyzed: gzhan de nyid smra ba la ci'i phyir khas mi len /
translated: disengaged, then why do you not assert that it is the one who speaks?üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúBecause we assert that it arises and is destroyed without

original: gal te de'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa skye ba dang 'jig par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa skye ba dang 'jig par khas len pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: following it,‚Äù

original: 'dir rjes su 'gro ba gang gang yin //
analyzed: 'dir rjes su 'gro ba gang gang yin //
translated: then what is the following here?

original: dngos po skye dang 'jig pa dag la'o //
analyzed: dngos po skye dang 'jig pa dag la'o //
translated: It is the arising and destruction of things.

original: nus pa'i ste /
analyzed: nus pa'i ste /
translated: It is the capacity.

original: de skye pa'i sngar dang 'jig pa'i phyis kyang yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de skye pa'i sngar dang 'jig pa'i phyis kyang yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it exists prior to its arising and after its destruction,

original: snga na med pa skye ba yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: snga na med pa skye ba yang ma yin pas /
translated: it does not arise without having existed previously.üîΩSince it does not arise without having existed previously, it is not

original: snga na med pa 'jig pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: snga na med pa 'jig pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: destroyed without having existed previously.üîΩIf it is not differentiated in any way, what is it that is differentiated

original: gal te thams cad du khyad par med pa yin na 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin /
analyzed: gal te thams cad du khyad par med pa yin na 'dir khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin /
translated: here?

original: tha snyad kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di gang gis byas /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam par dbye ba 'di gang gis byas /
translated: By whom is this conventional distinction made?

original: gal te @332a * //
analyzed: gal te @332a * //
translated: If you say,

original: gnas skabs khyad par dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs khyad par dang ldan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is differentiated in terms of its state,‚Äù

original: gnas skabs de dang nus pa de yang /
analyzed: gnas skabs de dang nus pa de yang /
translated: Are the state and the potency

original: ci ngo bo gcig yin nam /üîΩ'on te du ma yin /
analyzed: ci ngo bo gcig yin nam / 'on te du ma yin /
translated: the same or different?üîΩIf they are the same, then arising and nonarising,üîΩdestruction and nondestruction,üîΩunity and plurality, being directly perceptible and not being directly perceptible,üîΩbeing related to the performance of a function and being unrelated to the performance of a function, and so on,

original: gal te gcig yin na 'dir skye ba dang mi skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa dang / gcig nyid dang du ma dang mngon sum nyid dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid dang / don byed pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel ba med pa dag la stsogs pa gcig la rnam par dbye ba med pa'i bdag nyid la /üîΩrnam grangs med pa la /
analyzed: gal te gcig yin na 'dir skye ba dang mi skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / mi 'jig pa dang / gcig nyid dang du ma dang mngon sum nyid dang mngon sum ma yin pa nyid dang / don byed pa dang 'brel pa dang 'brel ba med pa dag la stsogs pa gcig la rnam par dbye ba med pa'i bdag nyid la / rnam grangs med pa la /
translated: would be indistinguishable in a single entity.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ci ltar rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba dag ci ltar rigs par 'gyur /
translated: How could mutually exclusive attributesüîΩbe tenable in a single entity that is not enumerated as multiple?

original: gal te gnas skabs dang / nus pa la dbye ba yod pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gnas skabs dang / nus pa la dbye ba yod pa de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no contradiction because the state and the potency are differentiated,

original: brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can lha dga' ba gnas skabs mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i ngang tshul can lha dga' ba gnas skabs mi shes pa yin no //
translated: then you are ignorant of the state of the gods‚Äô pleasure.

original: nus pa dang gnas skabs zhes bya ba ngo bo gcig pa rnam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang gnas skabs zhes bya ba ngo bo gcig pa rnam par dbye ba med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'di la 'gal ba brjod pa yin no //
translated: The position that ‚Äúpower and state‚Äù are one entity, without any distinction, is contradictory.

original: 'on te 'di la rnam par dbye ba yod na 'gal ba 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: 'on te 'di la rnam par dbye ba yod na 'gal ba 'ga' yang med la /
translated: But if there is a distinction, then there is no contradiction.

original: dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir gang la rjes su 'gro ba de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ma yin pa dag la /
analyzed: dngos po rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa skye ba dang / 'jig pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu mi 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir gang la rjes su 'gro ba de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag ma yin pa dag la /
translated: But then it would not follow that ‚Äúthings that are produced and disintegrate have a subsequent state.‚ÄùüîΩBecause that which has a subsequent state is not produced and does not disintegrate.

original: gang de dag rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang de dag rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is not produced and does not disintegrate does not have a subsequent state.

original: gal te de dag la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
