original: gcig kyang sgrub par byed pa de la gnod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgrub par byed pa gcig lta bu'o //
analyzed: gcig kyang sgrub par byed pa de la gnod par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // sgrub par byed pa gcig lta bu'o //
translated: For, just like a proof, it is subject to refutation.üîΩJust like a proof,

original: dper na don gcig la sgrub par byed pa gcig kho nas de 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na don gcig la sgrub par byed pa gcig kho nas de 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: for example, when one thing is established by a single proof,

original: thams cad blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: all the others are not to be accepted.

original: skyon brjod pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi mi brjod pa med pa'i phyir tshang gcad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon brjod pa nyid kyis gzhan gyi mi brjod pa med pa'i phyir tshang gcad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: And when one fault is stated, the others are not to be stated, because the mere statement of a fault is not a refutation.

original: de bas na phyogs snga ma smra ba dang phyogs phyi ma smra ba char bcad pa thob pa tshar gcod par mi byed pa de ltar na yang rigs pas byas na de dag las gcig kyang snga ma bzhin du rgyal ba dang pham pa dag ma yin no
analyzed: de bas na phyogs snga ma smra ba dang phyogs phyi ma smra ba char bcad pa thob pa tshar gcod par mi byed pa de ltar na yang rigs pas byas na de dag las gcig kyang snga ma bzhin du rgyal ba dang pham pa dag ma yin no
translated: Therefore, even if the proponent of the prior position and the proponent of the subsequent position do not obtain a refutation and do not refute each other, if they argue rationally, neither of them is a victor or a loser, as before.

original: // lan smra ba skyon ltar snang bar byed la rang gi sgrub par byed pas spangs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: // lan smra ba skyon ltar snang bar byed la rang gi sgrub par byed pas spangs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The respondent is not without a proof, since he is engaged in refuting the apparent fault.

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid sgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: For, the proof itself is not able to prove.

original: rgol pa rgyal ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rgol pa rgyal ba ma yin la /
translated: The respondent is not victorious.

original: skyon thams cad med par rab tu bstan pas sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon thams cad med par rab tu bstan pas sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, he has not established the member of proof, since he has not demonstrated the absence of all faults.

original: phyir rgol ba yang yang dag pa'i skyon ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba yang yang dag pa'i skyon ston par byed pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The opponent is not without a fault, since he does not demonstrate a true fault.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu yang brgal zhing brtag pa dor ba zhes bya ba pham pa'i rten ma yin no //üîΩgnas ma yin pa la tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rjes su sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu yang brgal zhing brtag pa dor ba zhes bya ba pham pa'i rten ma yin no // gnas ma yin pa la tshar gcad pa'i gnas su rjes su sbyor ba ni /
translated: Therefore, such a case is not a basis for defeat called ‚Äúabandoning the debate through questioning.‚ÄùüîΩApplication to a non-occasion for defeat is

original: rjes su sbyor ba med pa la rjes su sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su sbyor ba med pa la rjes su sbyor ba ste /
translated: application to that which is not an occasion for defeat.

original: tshar gcad pa'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid la log par nges pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i gnas kyi mtshan nyid la log par nges pa'i phyir /
translated: For, the opponent has wrongly ascertained the definition of an occasion for defeat.

original: gzhan tshar gcad pa'i gnas ma yin pa la tshar gcad par bya ba ma yin par khyed smra ba ni rjes su sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan tshar gcad pa'i gnas ma yin pa la tshar gcad par bya ba ma yin par khyed smra ba ni rjes su sbyor ba ste /
translated: Your statement that the opponent is not to be refuted is a subsequent application.

original: tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that he is to be refuted.

original: 'dir yang gal te rgol ba las /üîΩphyir @354a * //üîΩrgol bas sgrub par byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon mngon par sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'dir yang gal te rgol ba las / phyir @354a * // rgol bas sgrub par byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i skyon mngon par sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: Here, if the challengerüîΩuses a refutation that is not correct,üîΩand if the opponent applies a refutation that is not a fault to a non-fault,

original: des gnas ma yin pa dang skyon ma yin pa la tshar gcod pa'i gnas mngon par sbyor zhing rjod par byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: des gnas ma yin pa dang skyon ma yin pa la tshar gcod pa'i gnas mngon par sbyor zhing rjod par byed par 'gyur na /
translated: then the challenger should apply and state a refutation that is a fault to a fault.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i skyon brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i skyon brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi lan rtogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: However, since the challenger does not understand the definition of a correct refutation,

original: cig shos kyi lan ltar snang ba nyid bstan pa na spobs pa med pa nyid tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba /
analyzed: cig shos kyi lan ltar snang ba nyid bstan pa na spobs pa med pa nyid tshar gcad par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba /
translated: when he teaches the opponent‚Äôs apparent response, he is speechless.üîΩTherefore, he is to be refuted.

original: 'di las 'di tshar gcad pa'i gnas gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las 'di tshar gcad pa'i gnas gzhan ma yin no //
translated: This is not a different case of refutation than the previous one.

original: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i skyon brjod pa la gzhan gyis skyon ltar snang ba'i tshig gis mngon par sbyor zhing de yang dag pa'i skyon bstan pa la sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba'i tshig nyid kyis tshar gcad par bya baüîΩyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyir rgol ba sgrub par byed pa'i yang dag pa'i skyon brjod pa la gzhan gyis skyon ltar snang ba'i tshig gis mngon par sbyor zhing de yang dag pa'i skyon bstan pa la sgrub par byed pa ltar snang ba'i tshig nyid kyis tshar gcad par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, in order to prove a response, one applies words that appear to be a correct response to an opponent‚Äôs critique, and one refutes that correct response with words that appear to be a proof.üîΩThis is also not different from a fallacious reason.

original: de lta bu 'di yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag las tha dad pa med pa ste nges par yul gzhan khyad par bde ba'i don du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas nyid du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu 'di yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag las tha dad pa med pa ste nges par yul gzhan khyad par bde ba'i don du gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas nyid du brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be stated that it is a basis for refutation by a fallacious reason, for the purpose of distinguishing it from other objects.

original: de bstan na gzhan ston par byed pa don med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de bstan na gzhan ston par byed pa don med pa can yin no //
translated: If that is taught, then teaching others is pointless.

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not ascertained by accepting tenets.

original: tshig zhar la 'ongs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' med pa ste /
analyzed: tshig zhar la 'ongs pa ni grub pa'i mtha' med pa ste /
translated: A verbal digression is not a tenet.

original: de'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod par dam bcas nas /
analyzed: de'i don 'ga' zhig kyang yod par dam bcas nas /
translated: Having asserted that some meaning exists,

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi yul las zlog pa'i tshig zhar la 'ongs pa byed pa grub pa'i mtha' med par byed pa ni /
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi yul las zlog pa'i tshig zhar la 'ongs pa byed pa grub pa'i mtha' med par byed pa ni /
translated: The refutation of the thesis that the object of the thesis is reversed is the refutation of the thesis that the object of the thesis is reversed.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i med par shes pa ste /
translated: The refutation of the thesis that the object of the thesis is reversed is the refutation of the thesis that the object of the thesis is reversed.

original: dper na yod pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dper na yod pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: For example, what exists does not perish,

original: med pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and what does not exist does not arise.

original: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas phyogs rnam par 'jog par byed de /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' khas blangs nas phyogs rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: Having accepted the thesis, one posits the position.

original: rang bzhin gcig gis gsal ba 'di 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig gis gsal ba 'di 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because this manifestation is seen to follow the same nature,

original: 'ji ba'i rjes su 'gro ba kham por la sogs pa mthong ba ni rang bzhin gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'ji ba'i rjes su 'gro ba kham por la sogs pa mthong ba ni rang bzhin gcig nyid yin te /
translated: the manifestation of a pot, etc., which follows clay, is seen to be of the same nature.

original: de ltar na yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i gsal ba 'di'i dbye ba 'dzin pa na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i gsal ba 'di'i dbye ba 'dzin pa na /
translated: In that case, when grasping the distinction of this manifestation endowed with pleasure and pain,

original: de bde ba la sogs pa dag gi sgo nas rang bzhin gcig yin no //
analyzed: de bde ba la sogs pa dag gi sgo nas rang bzhin gcig yin no //
translated: it is of the same nature in terms of pleasure, etc.

original: des de skad du brgal zhing @354b brtag pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: des de skad du brgal zhing @354b brtag pa rjod par byed do //
translated: Thus, he states the objection in this way.

original: de la gzhan du rang bzhin gyi 'gyur ba zhes ji ltar mtshon par bya /
analyzed: de la gzhan du rang bzhin gyi 'gyur ba zhes ji ltar mtshon par bya /
translated: How can it be called a natural transformation?

original: chos gzhan ldog pa na chos gzhan 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan ldog pa na chos gzhan 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: That state in which one dharma ceases and another dharma arises is the nature of that .

original: chos gzhan gang yin pa de ni de'i 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: chos gzhan gang yin pa de ni de'i 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: That other dharma is its transformation.

original: ; de'i rang bzhin gyi don ldog pa las nges pa med pa'i tshig la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ; de'i rang bzhin gyi don ldog pa las nges pa med pa'i tshig la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of its nature is connected with the word ‚Äúnon-cessation.‚Äù

original: 'dis dam bcas pa med pa skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'dis dam bcas pa med pa skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: By this, it is said that what is not existent does not arise,

original: yod par 'jig par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes so //
analyzed: yod par 'jig par mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes so //
translated: and what is existent does not cease.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang mi mngon pa dang mngon pa dag med par par 'ga' zhig gis 'jug pa chad pa med pa dang / 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag kyang mi mngon pa dang mngon pa dag med par par 'ga' zhig gis 'jug pa chad pa med pa dang / 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba de ltar rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: And, ‚ÄúNeither existence nor non-existence are ever found by anyone to be either non-manifest or manifest, nor do they ever cease to be manifest or become manifest.‚ÄùüîΩHaving thus established this, he says,

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i bdag nyid 'jig pa dang / med pa'i yang bdag nyid thob pa khas blangs pas 'grub pa'i mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i bdag nyid 'jig pa dang / med pa'i yang bdag nyid thob pa khas blangs pas 'grub pa'i mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since you accept that the nature of an existent is to be destroyed and that the nature of a nonexistent is to be obtained, you have no tenet.

original: 'on te khas mi len na ni phyogs 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di la yang cung zad nges pa med pa'i phyir tshig zhar la 'ongs pa gang des med ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'on te khas mi len na ni phyogs 'grub par mi 'gyur ro // 'di la yang cung zad nges pa med pa'i phyir tshig zhar la 'ongs pa gang des med ba ni skye bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: But if you do not accept this, then your position is not established.üîΩHere, since there is no certainty whatsoever, you have stated a mere irrelevant statement, namely, ‚ÄúThat which is nonexistent does not arise, and that which is existent does not cease.‚ÄùüîΩIn order to prove that, you have stated, ‚ÄúBecause this single nature of manifestation is seen to be uniform.‚Äù

original: yod pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhes smras pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang bzhin gcig po gsal ba 'di rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di smras pa de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug ni rang bzhin gcig skye gnas tha dad ba mad pa de'i gsal ba 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa ni 'jig par mi 'gyur zhes smras pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang bzhin gcig po gsal ba 'di rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di smras pa de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang / gti mug ni rang bzhin gcig skye gnas tha dad ba mad pa de'i gsal ba 'di'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, since pleasure, pain, and delusion are seen to be uniform in this manifestation,

original: gsal ba de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad pa dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the nature of this manifestation is not different.

original: bde ba la sogs pa dag la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa dag la ni skye ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because pleasure and so on do not arise and disintegrate,üîΩit would be established that all that has that nature does not arise and disintegrate.

original: de'i bdag nyid can thams cad la skye 'jig med pa yin no zhes bya ba sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi skyon de mi brjod par bdag nyid 'dir rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'dra zhing /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can thams cad la skye 'jig med pa yin no zhes bya ba sgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la gtan tshigs kyi skyon de mi brjod par bdag nyid 'dir rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'dra zhing /
translated: Here, without stating the fault in the reason, he himself states that it is similar in nature to the characteristic of change,

original: rang bzhin dang 'brel ba med pas nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang 'brel ba med pas nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and because it is not related to its nature, it is uncertain.

original: tshig la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: tshig la 'jug par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he engages in verbal expression.

original: de la gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos can 'dir 'gyur bar brjod par bya ba yin @355a * //
analyzed: de la gsal ba zhes bya ba'i 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos can 'dir 'gyur bar brjod par bya ba yin @355a * //
translated: Here, the phenomenon that is the basis of engagement and disengagement is called ‚Äúmanifest.‚Äù

original: na bde ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: na bde ba la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But pleasure and so on are not like that.

original: gsal ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba dang bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If pleasure and so on are the nature of that which is manifest and that which is pleasure and so on,

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: the characteristic of the phenomenon that is engagement and disengagement would be undermined.

original: de dang bral ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de dang bral ba yin na ni /
translated: If it is free from that,

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: It is not of the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i mtshan nyid 'gal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is incompatible with the characteristic of manifestation.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin na ni des sgrub par byed pa'i skyon brjod pa'i phyogs sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin na ni des sgrub par byed pa'i skyon brjod pa'i phyogs sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the reason ‚Äúbecause of the perception of the concomitance of pleasure, etc.‚Äù is not established, then the opponent‚Äôs position is refuted by the fault in the proof.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon nye bar brjod pa med par brjod pa rgyas par byas nas rang gi skyon gzhan la 'gel bar byed do //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i skyon nye bar brjod pa med par brjod pa rgyas par byas nas rang gi skyon gzhan la 'gel bar byed do //
translated: Without mentioning the fault in the proof, he elaborates on the statement and attributes his own fault to the other.

original: gal te rnam pa 'di nyid kyis skyon 'di brjod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa 'di nyid kyis skyon 'di brjod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If he says that this very statement expresses the fault,

original: de ni sgyu skar mkhan gyi yul yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni sgyu skar mkhan gyi yul yin gyi /
translated: then that is the province of an astrologer,

original: 'jig rten pa sgras ma bstan pa'i don rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa sgras ma bstan pa'i don rtogs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a worldly person is not able to understand the meaning of a statement that is not taught.

original: de nyid ni 'dir glu gar mkhan gyi ri mo 'dri ba'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dir glu gar mkhan gyi ri mo 'dri ba'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is the way of drawing a picture of a dancer here.

original: 'di yang 'di skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di skad du bshad pa'i rigs pas /
translated: This is also stated in the following verse:

original: sngar sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs 'di brjod pa nyid kyi phyir tshar gcad par 'os pa yin gyi nges pa med pa'i phyir tshig zhar la 'ongs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs 'di brjod pa nyid kyi phyir tshar gcad par 'os pa yin gyi nges pa med pa'i phyir tshig zhar la 'ongs pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of being irrelevant, because it is not certain.

original: 'di yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang gtan tshigs ltar snang ba dag nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is also included among the fallacious reasons,

original: logs shig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: logs shig tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: so it should not be stated separately.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yang tshar gcad pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: The fallacious reasons as explained are also grounds for defeat.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan dang 'brel bas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan dang 'brel bas gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'am /
translated: A reason that is related to another characteristic is a ground for defeat.

original: dper na tshad ma dgag ma gzhal bya nyid kyis 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshad ma dgag ma gzhal bya nyid kyis 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a refutation of valid cognition is a refutation by the object of comprehension itself.

original: de'i phyir ji skad du bstan pa gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji skad du bstan pa gtan tshigs ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid kho na tshar gcad pa'i gnas su 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, the characteristic of a fallacious reason as explained is a ground for defeat.

original: 'dir yang ji skad du bshad pa smos pa dpyad par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang ji skad du bshad pa smos pa dpyad par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Here, too, what has been explained should be analyzed.

original: ci de dag ji skad du mtshon par byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba de lta bu nyid dam /
analyzed: ci de dag ji skad du mtshon par byed pa'i rab tu dbye ba de lta bu nyid dam /
translated: Is the classification of those just as it is represented?üîΩOr is it otherwise?

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan yin zhes te dpyad par bya @355b pa yin na yang /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan yin zhes te dpyad par bya @355b pa yin na yang /
translated: Although it should be analyzed,

original: 'di shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de ma spros /
analyzed: 'di shin tu thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de ma spros /
translated: we have not elaborated on this because it would lead to too great an extent.

original: ci ltar rigs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba de tsam 'dir 'dod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar rigs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba de tsam 'dir 'dod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, we assert only this much: it is proper to refute fallacious reasonings in whatever way is appropriate.

original: de nyid mthong la 'jig rten dag gi ma rig rab rib tshogs dag gcod byed pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid mthong la 'jig rten dag gi ma rig rab rib tshogs dag gcod byed pa'i //
translated: Seeing reality, they cut through the mass of ignorance and confusion of the world.
